term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - continuous flow enthalpimetry
term.title: continuous flow enthalpimetry

item.text: A term used to describe methods wherein a reagent is continuously fed into a flowing analyte stream and the temperature difference is measured before and after a reactor (mixing chamber). Alternatively, the temperature may be measured in a differential manner between a reference and a reactor chamber. The analyte concentration is directly proportional to the measured temperature difference. Synonymous with continuous flowenthalpimetric analysis.
